trends: There have been 22 other sightings in Norman
There were no other sightings in Norman on or around March 24th 2012
Summary: It was shaped like a donut, and had yellow-orange lights all over it, which were flashing in an odd pattern.
divs: Sighting DetailsThe sighting took place at 11:15 PM, this evening (March 24, 2012) in front of my apartment in Norman, OK. The object we saw was traveling from south to north. When we first noticed it, it was directly overhead and appeared to be about the size of a dime held at arm's length. It was shaped like a donut, and had yellow-orange lights all over it, which were flashing in an odd pattern. In fact, the object seemed to be expanding and contracting slightly. It was plainly visible in spite of the "light pollution" in the area, and we could detect no sound. When it was at its closest, we got a good enough look to be sure that it was not an ordinary airplane or astronomical object. It seemed to gain altitude as it moved north, and I watched it until it was no longer visible. It was heading in the general direction of Oklahoma City. Actually, we could not see the body to which the lights were attached. I say "donut" because there was a dark spot in the middle. I could not judge size or altitude, so I can't make a guess as to speed. My first thought was that it might be something attached to a blimp or advertising plane, but a) it was pretty late at night for that, and b) it was moving much too fast for a blimp.
